meanings.definition: The quality of being unreliable or inconsistent.
meanings.sent1: Her flakiness in keeping promises made it hard to trust her.
meanings.sent2: The flakiness of the weather forecast led to confusion.
meanings.sent3: His flakiness in showing up on time became a running joke among his friends.
meanings.sent4: The flakiness of the old building's foundation was a constant concern.
meanings.sent5: The flakiness of the internet connection caused frustration for the entire team.

meanings.definition: The tendency to break or crumble easily.
meanings.sent1: The flakiness of the pastry made it perfect for the pie crust.
meanings.sent2: The flakiness of the cookie indicated it was baked just right.
meanings.sent3: The flakiness of the sandcastle made it collapse with a gentle touch.
meanings.sent4: The flakiness of the old paint showed the need for a fresh coat.
meanings.sent5: The flakiness of the dry leaves underfoot added a satisfying crunch to each step.

meanings.definition: The act of criticizing or complaining.
meanings.sent1: Her constant flakiness about everything was exhausting to listen to.
meanings.sent2: The flakiness of his feedback made it hard to take him seriously.
meanings.sent3: The customer's flakiness about the service was met with a patient smile.
meanings.sent4: The flakiness of the online reviews made it difficult to judge the product.
meanings.sent5: The flakiness of the complaints showed a lack of understanding of the situation.
